LayoutNode.Content: ECML PKDD 2011 - The European Conference on Machine Learning and Principles and Practice of Knowledge Discovery in Databases
LayoutNode.SRC: ECML PKDD 2011 - The European Conference on Machine Learning and Principles and Practice of Knowledge Discovery in Databases

LayoutNode.Content: The European Conference on "Machine Learning" and "Principles and Practice of Knowledge Discovery in Databases" provides an international forum for the discussion of the latest high quality research results in all areas related to machine learning and knowledge discovery in databases and other innovative application domains.
LayoutNode.SRC: The European Conference on "Machine Learning" and "Principles and Practice of Knowledge Discovery in Databases" provides an international forum for the discussion of the latest high quality research results in all areas related to machine learning and knowledge discovery in databases and other innovative application domains.

LayoutNode.Content: We invite submissions on all aspects of machine learning, knowledge discovery and data mining. We especially encourage submissions of papers that describe the application of machine learning and data mining methods to real-world problems, and highlight new research challenges in new domains such as the web, medicine, biology, neuroscience, engineering, government fields. Submissions that demonstrate both theoretical and empirical rigor are also highly encouraged.
LayoutNode.SRC: We invite submissions on all aspects of machine learning, knowledge discovery and data mining. We especially encourage submissions of papers that describe the application of machine learning and data mining methods to real-world problems, and highlight new research challenges in new domains such as the web, medicine, biology, neuroscience, engineering, government fields. Submissions that demonstrate both theoretical and empirical rigor are also highly encouraged.

LayoutNode.Content: The conference proceedings will be published by Springer Verlag ("Lecture Notes in Artificial Intelligence Series").
LayoutNode.SRC: The conference proceedings will be published by Springer Verlag ("Lecture Notes in Artificial Intelligence Series").

LayoutNode.Content: Data Mining and Knowledge Discovery Machine Learning
LayoutNode.SRC: Data Mining and Knowledge Discovery Machine Learning

LayoutNode.Content: All aspects of the submission and notification process will be handled online via the Microsoft CMT.
LayoutNode.SRC: All aspects of the submission and notification process will be handled online via the Microsoft CMT.

LayoutNode.Content: The papers must be written in English and formatted according to the Springer-Verlag Lecture Notes in Artificial Intelligence guidelines. Authors instructions and style files can be downloaded at:
LayoutNode.SRC: The papers must be written in English and formatted according to the Springer-Verlag Lecture Notes in Artificial Intelligence guidelines. Authors instructions and style files can be downloaded at:

LayoutNode.Content: The maximum length of papers is 16 pages in this format.
LayoutNode.SRC: The maximum length of papers is 16 pages in this format.

LayoutNode.Content: Papers submitted should report original work; ECML PKDD 2011 will not accept any paper which, at the time of submission, is under review or has already been accepted for publication in a journal or another conference. Authors are also expected not to submit their papers elsewhere during the review period.
LayoutNode.SRC: Papers submitted should report original work; ECML PKDD 2011 will not accept any paper which, at the time of submission, is under review or has already been accepted for publication in a journal or another conference. Authors are also expected not to submit their papers elsewhere during the review period.

LayoutNode.Content: Papers submitted to ECML PKDD 2011 will normally be reviewed by minimum of two referees. The review process will be double blind (read more). Student submissions should be clearly indicated on the submission form.
LayoutNode.SRC: Papers submitted to ECML PKDD 2011 will normally be reviewed by minimum of two referees. The review process will be double blind (read more). Student submissions should be clearly indicated on the submission form.

LayoutNode.Content: ECML PKDD 2011 will take place in Athens, Greece. Athens is the capital of Greece, standing at a strategic point in southeastern Europe, with unique historical and cultural assets and a location of exceptional natural beauty, privileged with a perfect weather climate.
